definitions.definition: to press something very hard so that it is broken or its shape is destroyed:
examples: The package had been badly crushed in the post.

definitions.definition: to press paper or cloth so that it becomes full of folds and is no longer flat:
examples: My dress got all crushed in my suitcase.

definitions.definition: If people are crushed against other people or things, they are pressed against them:
examples: Tragedy struck when several people were crushed to death in the crowd.

definitions.definition: a strong but temporary feeling of liking someone:
examples: She has a crush on one of her teachers at school.
